title: Getting Started with the `controlcharts` package
text: Consider basic time-series, comprised two-years monthly data: default, spc() function construct -chart (individuals chart; also referred XmR-chart): result spc() function list containing three elements: static_plot: static SVG plot SPC chart html_plot: HTML widget containing interactive SPC chart (use Shiny/interactive contexts) limits: data frame containing calculated control limits
code: # Simulate 2 years of monthly data dat <- data.frame(   month = seq(as.Date('2024-01-01'), length.out = 24, by = "month"),   y = rnorm(24) )  knitr::kable(head(dat)) spc_chart <- controlcharts::spc(data = dat,                                 numerators = y,                                 keys = month) spc_chart$static_plot # If you are using an interactive environment, you can display the HTML widget: # spc_chart$html_plot # Display the control limits knitr::kable(head(spc_chart$limits), digits = 2)

title: Getting Started with the `controlcharts` package
text: interface provided funnel charts. example, consider proportion data recorded 10 organisations: funnel plots, default proportions (PR) chart:
code: # Simulate proportion data for 10 organisations denoms <- sample(100:200, 10) funnel_data <- data.frame(   organisation = letters[1:10],   numerators = rbinom(10, size = denoms, prob = 0.2),   denominators = denoms )  knitr::kable(funnel_data) funnel_chart <- controlcharts::funnel(data = funnel_data,                                        numerators = numerators,                                        denominators = denominators,                                        keys = organisation) funnel_chart$static_plot knitr::kable(funnel_chart$limits, digits = 2)

title: Portable Interactive Control Charts
text: key limitation interactive plots/charts R need Shiny server order handle data processing statistical calculations. controlcharts package overcomes performing calculations JavaScript, allowing charts fully portable interactive without need server. constructing charts using crosstalk data objects, multiple charts can also linked together allow interactive filtering highlighting fully portable format. controlcharts package also performs necessary data aggregations pre-processing JavaScript. means users need pre-aggregate manipulate data creating charts, simplifying workflow making easier create interactive visualisations directly raw data. also allows dynamic data exploration, users can filter interact charts without needing re-run R code.

title: Portable Interactive Control Charts
text: Consider dataset containing monthly numerators denominators 10 different organisations 2-year period:
code: library(controlcharts)  set.seed(12324)  dat <- do.call(   rbind.data.frame,   lapply(toupper(letters[1:10]), function(grp) {     denom <- sample(0:100, 24)     data.frame(       country = sample(c("C1", "C2", "C3"), 1, replace = TRUE),       organisation = grp,       month_start = seq(as.Date('2024-01-01'), length.out=24, by="month"),       numerators = rbinom(n = 24, size = denom, prob = 0.3),       denominators = denom     )   }) ) DT::datatable(dat)

title: Portable Interactive Control Charts
text: SPC charts funnel plots can constructed data directly, resulting HTML plots supporting mouseover tooltips:
code: spc_plt <- controlcharts::spc(data = dat,                               keys = month_start,                               numerators = numerators,                               denominators = denominators,                               spc_setting = list(chart_type = "p"),                               outlier_settings = list(astronomical = TRUE,                                                       shift = TRUE,                                                       two_in_three = TRUE),                               nhs_icon_settings = list(show_variation_icons = TRUE))  fun_plt <- controlcharts::funnel(data = dat,                                  keys = organisation,                                  numerators = numerators,                                  denominators = denominators)   spc_plt$html_plot fun_plt$html_plot

what: Cross-plot Reactivity and Dynamic Calculations: Crosstalk
title: Portable Interactive Control Charts
text: converting data crosstalk::SharedData object, multiple charts can linked together allow interactive filtering highlighting. aggregations, filtering, statistical calculations performed dynamically JavaScript, charts remain fully portable interactive without need Shiny server. can use crosstalk filters allow users dynamically filter data displayed charts. filters adjusted, data aggregations statistical calculations updated real-time within charts:
code: # Convert data to crosstalk SharedData object crosstalk_dat <- crosstalk::SharedData$new(dat)  # Create charts using crosstalk data spc_plt <- controlcharts::spc(data = crosstalk_dat,                               keys = month_start,                               numerators = numerators,                               denominators = denominators,                               spc_setting = list(chart_type = "p"),                               outlier_settings = list(astronomical = TRUE,                                                       shift = TRUE,                                                       two_in_three = TRUE),                               nhs_icon_settings = list(show_variation_icons = TRUE))  fun_plt <- controlcharts::funnel(data = crosstalk_dat,                                  keys = organisation,                                  numerators = numerators,                                  denominators = denominators) country_filter <- crosstalk::filter_select("countryFilter", "Country",                                              crosstalk_dat, ~country) org_filter <- crosstalk::filter_select("orgFilter", "Organisation",                                          crosstalk_dat, ~organisation) date_filter <- crosstalk::filter_slider("monthFilter", "Date",                                         crosstalk_dat, ~month_start) crosstalk::bscols(   date_filter,   org_filter,   country_filter ) crosstalk::bscols(   fun_plt$html_plot,   spc_plt$html_plot )

what: Interactive Plotting for Funnel and Statistical Process Control Charts
title: Interactive Plotting for Funnel and Statistical Process Control Charts
text: controlcharts package aims provide comprehensive set tools calculating visualising statistical process control (SPC) charts funnel plots R. package implemented wrapper around existing code Power BI custom visuals SPC Charts Funnel Plots. data pre-processing, calculation control limits, plotting functions implemented Javascript, provides powerful flexibility use interactive contexts.

title: Interactive Plotting for Funnel and Statistical Process Control Charts

code: # Simulate 2 years of monthly data dat <- data.frame(   month = seq(as.Date('2024-01-01'), length.out = 24, by = "month"),   y = rnorm(24) )  knitr::kable(head(dat)) spc_chart <- controlcharts::spc(data = dat,                                 numerators = y,                                 keys = month) spc_chart$static_plot # If you are using an interactive environment, you can display the HTML widget: # spc_chart$html_plot # Display the control limits knitr::kable(head(spc_chart$limits), digits = 2)

code: # Simulate proportion data for 10 organisations denoms <- sample(100:200, 10) funnel_data <- data.frame(   organisation = letters[1:10],   numerators = rbinom(10, size = denoms, prob = 0.2),   denominators = denoms )  knitr::kable(funnel_data) funnel_chart <- controlcharts::funnel(data = funnel_data,                                        numerators = numerators,                                        denominators = denominators,                                        keys = organisation) funnel_chart$static_plot knitr::kable(funnel_chart$limits, digits = 2)

what: controlcharts: Interactive Plotting for Funnel and Statistical Process Control Charts — controlcharts-package
title: controlcharts: Interactive Plotting for Funnel and Statistical Process Control Charts — controlcharts-package
text: Generate fully interactive dynamic funnel plots statistical process control (SPC) charts. data manaipulation, calculation, plotting done JavaScript, allowing completely dynamic charts without need Shiny server.

title: Shiny bindings for wrapper — funnel-shiny
text: Output render functions using wrapper within Shiny applications interactive Rmd documents.

title: Shiny bindings for wrapper — funnel-shiny
code: funnelOutput(outputId, width = "100%", height = "400px")  renderfunnel(expr, env = parent.frame(), quoted = FALSE)

title: Shiny bindings for wrapper — funnel-shiny
text: outputId output variable read width, height Must valid CSS unit (like '100%', '400px', 'auto') number, coerced string 'px' appended. expr expression generates wrapper env environment evaluate expr. quoted expr quoted expression (quote())? useful want save expression variable.

title: Generate interactive Funnel chart — funnel
text: Generate interactive Funnel chart

title: Generate interactive Funnel chart — funnel
code: funnel(   data,   keys,   numerators,   denominators,   tooltips,   labels,   aggregations = list(numerators = "sum", denominators = "sum", tooltips = "first",     labels = "first"),   canvas_settings = NULL,   funnel_settings = NULL,   outlier_settings = NULL,   scatter_settings = NULL,   line_settings = NULL,   x_axis_settings = NULL,   y_axis_settings = NULL,   label_settings = NULL,   width = NULL,   height = NULL,   elementId = NULL )

title: Generate interactive Funnel chart — funnel
text: data data frame containing data chart. keys vector column name representing categories chart. numerators numeric vector column name representing numerators category. denominators numeric vector column name representing denominators category. tooltips vector column name representing tooltips category. labels vector column name representing labels category. aggregations list aggregation function names field multiple values provided key. Valid options : "first": returns first value "last": returns last value "sum": returns sum values "mean": returns mean values "min": returns minimum value "max": returns maximum value "median": returns median value "count": returns count values canvas_settings Optional list settings canvas, see funnel_default_settings('canvas') valid options. funnel_settings Optional list settings Funnel chart, see funnel_default_settings('funnel') valid options. outlier_settings Optional list settings outliers, see funnel_default_settings('outliers') valid options. scatter_settings Optional list settings scatter points, see funnel_default_settings('scatter') valid options. line_settings Optional list settings lines, see funnel_default_settings('lines') valid options. x_axis_settings Optional list settings x-axis, see funnel_default_settings('x_axis') valid options. y_axis_settings Optional list settings y-axis, see funnel_default_settings('y_axis') valid options. label_settings Optional list settings labels, see funnel_default_settings('labels') valid options. width Optional width chart pixels. NULL (default), chart fill width container. height Optional height chart pixels. NULL (default), chart fill height container. elementId Optional HTML element ID chart.

title: Generate interactive Funnel chart — funnel
text: object class controlchart containing interactive plot, static plot, limits data frame, raw data, function save plot.

title: Shiny bindings for wrapper — spc-shiny
text: outputId output variable read width, height Must valid CSS unit (like '100%', '400px', 'auto') number, coerced string 'px' appended. expr expression generates wrapper env environment evaluate expr. quoted expr quoted expression (quote())? useful want save expression variable.

title: Generate interactive SPC chart — spc
text: Generate interactive SPC chart

title: Generate interactive SPC chart — spc
code: spc(   data,   keys,   numerators,   denominators,   groupings,   xbar_sds,   tooltips,   labels,   aggregations = list(numerators = "sum", denominators = "sum", groupings = "first",     xbar_sds = "first", tooltips = "first", labels = "first"),   canvas_settings = NULL,   spc_settings = NULL,   outlier_settings = NULL,   nhs_icon_settings = NULL,   scatter_settings = NULL,   line_settings = NULL,   x_axis_settings = NULL,   y_axis_settings = NULL,   date_settings = NULL,   label_settings = NULL,   width = NULL,   height = NULL,   elementId = NULL )

title: Generate interactive SPC chart — spc
text: data data frame containing data chart. keys vector column name representing categories (x-axis) chart. numerators numeric vector column name representing numerators category. denominators numeric vector column name representing denominators category. groupings vector column name representing grouping category. xbar_sds numeric vector column name representing x-bar standard deviation values category. tooltips vector column name representing tooltips category. labels vector column name representing labels category. aggregations list aggregation function names field multiple values provided key. Valid options : "first": returns first value "last": returns last value "sum": returns sum values "mean": returns mean values "min": returns minimum value "max": returns maximum value "median": returns median value "count": returns count values canvas_settings Optional list settings canvas, see spc_default_settings('canvas') valid options. spc_settings Optional list settings SPC chart, see spc_default_settings('spc') valid options. outlier_settings Optional list settings outliers, see spc_default_settings('outliers') valid options. nhs_icon_settings Optional list settings NHS icons, see spc_default_settings('nhs_icons') valid options. scatter_settings Optional list settings scatter points, see spc_default_settings('scatter') valid options. line_settings Optional list settings lines, see spc_default_settings('lines') valid options. x_axis_settings Optional list settings x-axis, see spc_default_settings('x_axis') valid options. y_axis_settings Optional list settings y-axis, see spc_default_settings('y_axis') valid options. date_settings Optional list settings dates, see spc_default_settings('dates') valid options. label_settings Optional list settings labels, see spc_default_settings('labels') valid options. width Optional width chart pixels. NULL (default), chart fill width container. height Optional height chart pixels. NULL (default), chart fill height container. elementId Optional HTML element ID chart.

title: Generate interactive SPC chart — spc
text: object class controlchart containing interactive plot, static plot, limits data frame, raw data, function save plot.

what: Get default settings for SPC charts — spc_default_settings
title: Get default settings for SPC charts — spc_default_settings
text: Retrieve default settings SPC charts specific settings group.

title: Get default settings for SPC charts — spc_default_settings
Get default settings for SPC charts — spc_default_settings
text: group Optional. specific settings group retrieve. NULL, settings groups returned.

title: Get default settings for SPC charts — spc_default_settings
text: list default settings SPC charts specified settings group.

title: Get default settings for SPC charts — spc_default_settings
code: #' # Get all default settings for SPC charts spc_default_settings() #> $canvas #> $canvas$show_errors #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $canvas$lower_padding #> [1] 10 #>  #> $canvas$upper_padding #> [1] 10 #>  #> $canvas$left_padding #> [1] 10 #>  #> $canvas$right_padding #> [1] 10 #>  #>  #> $spc #> $spc$chart_type #> [1] "i" #>  #> $spc$outliers_in_limits #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $spc$multiplier #> [1] 1 #>  #> $spc$sig_figs #> [1] 2 #>  #> $spc$perc_labels #> [1] "Automatic" #>  #> $spc$split_on_click #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $spc$num_points_subset #> NULL #>  #> $spc$subset_points_from #> [1] "Start" #>  #> $spc$ttip_show_date #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $spc$ttip_label_date #> [1] "Date" #>  #> $spc$ttip_show_numerator #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $spc$ttip_label_numerator #> [1] "Numerator" #>  #> $spc$ttip_show_denominator #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $spc$ttip_label_denominator #> [1] "Denominator" #>  #> $spc$ttip_show_value #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $spc$ttip_label_value #> [1] "Automatic" #>  #> $spc$ll_truncate #> NULL #>  #> $spc$ul_truncate #> NULL #>  #>  #> $outliers #> $outliers$process_flag_type #> [1] "both" #>  #> $outliers$improvement_direction #> [1] "increase" #>  #> $outliers$astronomical #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $outliers$astronomical_limit #> [1] "3 Sigma" #>  #> $outliers$ast_colour_improvement #> [1] "#00B0F0" #>  #> $outliers$ast_colour_deterioration #> [1]
